label: EPAM Systems
description: As a Frontend Developer, I developed an e-commerce platform using the React Hydrogen framework.
Being one of the 4 JS engineers on our project, I took responsibility for handling complex and business-critical tasks (new features, supporting existing functionality, SPA SEO optimization)
Personally developed key features such as the shopping cart, product showcase, store search, and the homepage.
I also refactored legacy code, resulting in a 30% reduction in overall code size.
Worked closely with a UI/UX designer to improve the internal library of UI components.
Additionally, I successfully negotiated with the client to enhance the project and delivered results within sprints.
Reduced project bundle size, refactored legacy code, and optimized application performance.
Participated in conducting code reviews and providing feedback to project colleagues, contributing to improved code quality and team collaboration.
Implemented optimal caching methods and lazy loading to speed up page load times and improve user experience.
Developed project documentation and trained new team members, helping them quickly understand the project and start actively interacting with colleagues.
